result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Modification of Bail, filed by Attorney Bonneson.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/20/2022 (received 10/18/2022 by jail staff) requesting a bail reduction.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/24/2022 - The defendant needs to work with counsel if he wishes to file another bail motion.**
AMENDED Trial Scheduling Order Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 10/17/22
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 10/17/22

Jury status hearing on December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Made on the record in court at the 10/17/2022 Hearing.

10:33 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Bobby P Somsak.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Bonneson notes he filed a motion to modify bail and is asking it be addressed today.  Atty. Bonneson presents arguments; he is asking the bond be modified to a lower cash bail or signature bond.  State objects and presents arguments.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the Motion to Modify Bail; bail remains as previously set.  Atty. Bonneson advises his client is making a Speedy Trial Demand in this matter as well and is asking the matter be set for a 2-3 day jury trial.  Court will accept the Speedy Trial demand and schedule this matter for jury status and jury trial.  Court to prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Motion for Modification of Bail, filed by Attorney Bonneson.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10-5-22.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on October 7, 2022 - Defendant to reach out to his attorney to file a motion.**

3:54 PM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Bobby P Somsak.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes this matter was set for hearing to address defendant's request to address bail for Branch 2.  Atty. Bonneson raises some concerns with respect to scheduling and notes he was just appointed to both matters.  Atty. Bonneson presents additional statements and requests to withdraw as counsel.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Atty. Bonneson's request to withdraw as counsel.  Court will also maintain the previously scheduled motion hearing, jury status, and jury trial dates in 22CF325 with this matter tagging along with for status.

Court will next address the defendant's request to modify bail.  State objects and presents statements.  Atty. Bonneson is asking that the bail be modified to a signature bond.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the defendant's request to modify bail; bail remains as previously set.  Court will maintain the currently scheduled further proceedings date on 10/17/2022 to address the jury status and trial dates in 22CF325.  Court also advises Atty. Bonneson to discuss the case with his client and the PD's office and if he still wants to withdraw from the case he needs to file a formal motion to withdraw prior to the next court date.
Bail/bond hearing on October 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Letter from Attorney Bonneson requesting that the hearing scheduled for 10/5/2022 be rescheduled to the afternoon on the same date. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - Approved.  Hearing will be held on 10/5/22 at 3:30**
Attorney Paul Bonneson
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 9/28/2022 regarding bail reduction and his speedy trial demand.
Bail/bond hearing on October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 9/26/2022 requesting a bail reduction.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/29/2022 - Schedule for a bail/bond hearing in front of Branch 7 due to Branch 2 being in trial next month.**

1:45 PM Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Bobby P Somsak. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Case called for status. 
Atty Singleton makes a motion to withdraw from the cases due to a conflict of interest.
Court allows Atty Singleton to withdraw. 
Atty Singleton left a message for the State Public Defender to appoint a new attorney. 
Court finds good cause to withdraw the Speedy Trial Demand.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Character letter to the Court, filed by defendant's sister in support of defendant.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Entered in Court by defense on September 23, 2022

11:04 AM Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Bobby P Somsak.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Singleton requests a preliminary hearing noting there was a contingent offer given last night but the defendant does not wish to take this offer.  
ADA Sitzberger states that pretrial offer is now revoked, as it was contingent on waiving the prelim.
State indicates their witness is not present and requests a moment to reach out to their office.  
Attorney Singleton states he is not in a position to waive time limits and defendant does not wish to waive the preliminary hearing.  
Court takes recess at 11:08 am.
Case recalled at 11:25 am.  
Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Bobby P Somsak.  Jack Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a preliminary hearing.

ADA Randy Sitzberger sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Pitzo.
Cross examination by attorney Singleton.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over, moving to dismiss.  
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
Attorney Singleton stands mute as to a plea.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
Bail remains as fixed. 
Attorney Singleton enters a speedy trial demand.
The Court was inclined to set this over with the defendants other case, 22CF325 for November 16, 2022 at 3:00 pm but given the Speedy Trial Demand, the Court will set a status date as soon as possible before the Trial Court to address scheduling a trial.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS. Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated wit drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

1:57 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Bobby P Somsak. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
